thread.title: Abandoned dog found near Otley given new home | Calendar
thread.title_full: Abandoned dog found near Otley given new home | Calendar - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Abandoned dog found near Otley given new home | Calendar
text:
A dog that was abandoned in a car near Otley has been given a new home thanks to the help of residents of the local community.
Police believe the dog had been left alone in the car for around 15 hours Credit: North Yorkshire Police North Yorkshire Police were called to reports that a red Volvo V40 car had been abandoned on Castley Lane, near Otley.
On Sunday 12 February 2017, PC Marie Scott and PCSO Alastair Graham-Merrett, of Knaresborough Neighbourhood Policing Team attended the vehicle, and found a dog inside.
Although the lurcher type cross was in good health, it had been left alone in the car for around 15 hours.
The dog was taken to a local kennel to be looked after.
Enquiries are ongoing to trace the vehicleâ€™s owner, but in the mean time, a member of the local community has come forward and given the dog a new home.
Checks on the vehicle showed it was untaxed and uninsured, and on Tuesday 14 February it was recovered by police and taken away.
Last updated Wed 22 Feb 2017 North Yorkshire Otley
